methods.Synopsis: Find members of Congress by a latitude and longitude, or by a zip code. All Senators or Representatives who may represent the given location or zip are returned.

parameters.Name: latitude
parameters.Description: The latitude of the location.

parameters.Name: longitude
parameters.Description: The longitude of the location.

parameters.Name: zip
parameters.Description: Zip code of the location.

methods.Synopsis: Search and filter for members of Congress. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: query
parameters.Description: A string fragment to match against members' name fields.

parameters.Name: title
parameters.Description: Title of this member. "Sen", "Rep", "Del", or "Com".

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: Chamber the member is in. "senate" or "house".

parameters.Name: first_name
parameters.Description: The member's first name. This may or may not be the name they are usually called.

parameters.Name: nickname
parameters.Description: The member's nickname. If present, usually safe to assume this is the name they go by.

parameters.Name: middle_name
parameters.Description: The member's middle name, if they have one.

parameters.Name: last_name
parameters.Description: The member's last name.

parameters.Name: name_suffix
parameters.Description: A name suffix, if the member uses one. For example, "Jr." or "III".

parameters.Name: party
parameters.Description: First letter of the party this member belongs to. "R", "D", or "I".

parameters.Name: state
parameters.Description: Two-letter code (uppercase) of the state this member represents.

parameters.Name: state_name
parameters.Description: The full state name of the state this member represents.

parameters.Name: district
parameters.Description: The number of the district that a House member represents. Is null for senators.

parameters.Name: in_office
parameters.Description: Whether a member is currently holding elected office in Congress.

parameters.Name: gender
parameters.Description: First letter of this member's current gender. "M" or "F".

parameters.Name: birthdate
parameters.Description: Date of the member's birth in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.Name: term_start
parameters.Description: The date a member's current term started, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.Name: term_end
parameters.Description: The date a member's current term ended, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.Name: senate_class
parameters.Description: Which senate "class" the member belongs to (1, 2, or 3). Every 2 years, a separate one third of the Senate is elected to a 6-year term. Senators of the same class face election in the same year. Blank for members of the House.

parameters.Name: bioguide_id
parameters.Description: Identifier for this member in various Congressional sources. Originally taken from the Congressional Biographical Directory, but used in many places. If you're going to pick one ID as a Congressperson's unique ID, use this.

parameters.Name: thomas_id
parameters.Description: Identifier for this member as it appears on THOMAS.gov and Congress.gov.

parameters.Name: lis_id
parameters.Description: Identifier for this member as it appears on some of Congress' data systems (namely Senate votes).

parameters.Name: votesmart_id
parameters.Description: Identifier for this member as it appears on Project Vote Smart.

parameters.Name: fec_ids
parameters.Description: Identifier for this member as they appear in filings at the Federal Election Commission.

parameters.Name: govtrack_id
parameters.Description: Identifier for this member as it appears on GovTrack.us.

parameters.Name: crp_id
parameters.Description: Identifier for this member as it appears on CRP's OpenSecrets.

methods.Synopsis: Find congressional districts by a latitude and longitude, or a zip code.

parameters.Name: latitude
parameters.Description: The latitude of the location.

parameters.Name: longitude
parameters.Description: The longitude of the location.

parameters.Name: zip
parameters.Description: A zip code may intersect multiple Congressional districts, so it is not as precise as using a latitude and longitude.

methods.Synopsis: Search and filter committees and subcommittees in the House and Senate.

parameters.Name: query
parameters.Description: A string fragment to match against committees' names.

parameters.Name: committee_id
parameters.Description: Official ID of the committee, as it appears in various official sources (Senate, House, and Library of Congress).

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber this committee is part of. "house", "senate", or "joint".

parameters.Name: subcommittee
parameters.Description: Whether or not the committee is a subcommittee.

parameters.Name: member_ids
parameters.Description: Enter a member's bioguide ID to find all committees/subcommittees that member is on.

parameters.Name: parent_committee_id
parameters.Description: If the committee is a subcommittee, the ID of its parent committee.

methods.Synopsis: Search and filter bills in the House and Senate. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: query
parameters.Description: A string fragment to match against bills' names, summary, and keywords.

parameters.Name: bill_id
parameters.Description: A unique ID for a bill.

parameters.Name: bill_type
parameters.Description: The type of a bill.

parameters.Name: number
parameters.Description: The bill's number

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The Congress in which this bill was introduced

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber of Congress in which the bill originated.

parameters.Name: keywords
parameters.Description: Search through official keywords assigned by the Library of Congress.

parameters.Name: history.house_passage_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the House voted on passage, pre-veto.

parameters.Name: history.senate_cloture_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the Senate voted on cloture.

parameters.Name: history.senate_passage_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the Senate voted on passage, pre-veto.

parameters.Name: history.vetoed
parameters.Description: Whether the bill has been vetoed.

parameters.Name: history.house_override_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the House voted on passage to override a veto.

parameters.Name: history.senate_override_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the Senate voted on passage to override a veto.

parameters.Name: history.awaiting_signature
parameters.Description: Whether the bill is currently awaiting the President's signature.

parameters.Name: history.enacted
parameters.Description: Whether the bill has been enacted into law.

parameters.Name: sponsor_id
parameters.Description: The bioguide ID of the legislator sponsoring the bill.

parameters.Name: cosponsor_ids
parameters.Description: A bioguide ID of a legislator cosponsoring the bill.

parameters.Name: withdrawn_cosponsor_ids
parameters.Description: A bioguide ID of a legislator who has withdrawn their cosponsorship of the bill.

parameters.Name: committee_ids
parameters.Description: An ID of a committee this bill is relevant to.

methods.Synopsis: Filter and search through the full text of bills in the House and Senate. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields. The main difference between this and the /bills method is that the 'query' parameter is now treated as a proper search query, with operators. You must also quote phrases to maintain term order.

parameters.Name: query
parameters.Description: A query string to match against bills' names, summary, keywords, and full text. Can include wildcards (*). Quote phrases to maintain term order.

parameters.Name: highlight
parameters.Description: Include highlighted excerpts of results.

parameters.Name: bill_id
parameters.Description: A unique ID for a bill.

parameters.Name: bill_type
parameters.Description: The type of a bill.

parameters.Name: number
parameters.Description: The bill's number

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The Congress in which this bill was introduced

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber of Congress in which the bill originated.

parameters.Name: keywords
parameters.Description: Search through official keywords assigned by the Library of Congress.

parameters.Name: history.house_passage_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the House voted on passage, pre-veto.

parameters.Name: history.senate_cloture_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the Senate voted on cloture.

parameters.Name: history.senate_passage_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the Senate voted on passage, pre-veto.

parameters.Name: history.vetoed
parameters.Description: Whether the bill has been vetoed.

parameters.Name: history.house_override_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the House voted on passage to override a veto.

parameters.Name: history.senate_override_result
parameters.Description: The result of the last time the Senate voted on passage to override a veto.

parameters.Name: history.awaiting_signature
parameters.Description: Whether the bill is currently awaiting the President's signature.

parameters.Name: history.enacted
parameters.Description: Whether the bill has been enacted into law.

parameters.Name: sponsor_id
parameters.Description: The bioguide ID of the legislator sponsoring the bill.

parameters.Name: cosponsor_ids
parameters.Description: A bioguide ID of a legislator cosponsoring the bill.

parameters.Name: withdrawn_cosponsor_ids
parameters.Description: A bioguide ID of a legislator who has withdrawn their cosponsorship of the bill.

parameters.Name: committee_ids
parameters.Description: An ID of a committee this bill is relevant to.

methods.Synopsis: Filter through amendments in Congress. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: amendment_id
parameters.Description: The unique ID for this amendment. Formed from the _amendment_type_, _number_, and _congress_.

parameters.Name: amendment_type
parameters.Description: The type for this amendment. For the amendment “H.Amdt. 10”, the amendment_type represents the “H.Amdt.” part.

parameters.Name: number
parameters.Description: The number for this amendment. For the amendment “H.Amdt. 10”, the number is 10.

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The Congress in which this amendment was introduced

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber of Congress in which the amendment was introduced.

parameters.Name: house_number
parameters.Description: If the amendment was introduced in the House, this is a relative amendment number, scoped to the bill or treaty the House it relates to.

parameters.Name: introduced_on
parameters.Description: The date this amendment was introduced, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.Name: last_action_at
parameters.Description: The date and/or time of the most recent official action on the amendment, in ISO-8601 format. Often, there are no official actions, in which case this field will be set to the value of introduced_on.

methods.Synopsis: Search and filter through presidential nominations in Congress. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: nomination_id
parameters.Description: The unique identifier for this nomination, taken from the Library of Congress. Of the form “PN[number]-[congress]”.

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The Congress in which this nomination was presented.

parameters.Name: number
parameters.Description: The number of this nomination, taken from the Library of Congress. Can occasionally contain hyphens, e.g. “PN64-01”.

parameters.Name: received_on
parameters.Description: The date this nomination was received in the Senate, in the form YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.Name: last_action_at
parameters.Description: The date and/or time this nomination last received action. If there are no official actions, then this field will fall back to the value of received_on.

parameters.Name: organization
parameters.Description: The organization the nominee would be appointed to, if confirmed.

parameters.Name: committee_ids
parameters.Description: The ID of a committee that the nomination has been referred to for consideration. Multiple committees may be returned in responses; queries can only specify a single committee.

parameters.Name: nominees.position
parameters.Description: The position the nominee is being nominated for.

parameters.Name: nominees.state
parameters.Description: The which state in the United States this nominee hails from. This field is only available for some nominees, and never for batches of multiple nominees.

methods.Synopsis: Search and filter votes in the House and Senate. Generally current within an hour of the vote taking place. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: query
parameters.Description: A string fragment to match against votes' question fields.

parameters.Name: roll_id
parameters.Description: A unique identifier for a roll call vote. Made from the first letter of the chamber, the vote number, and the legislative year (e.g. "h24-2012").

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber the vote was taken in. "house" or "senate".

parameters.Name: number
parameters.Description: The number that vote was assigned. Numbers reset every legislative year.

parameters.Name: year
parameters.Description: The "legislative year" of the vote. This is not quite the same as the calendar year - the legislative year changes at noon EST on January 3rd. A vote taken on January 1, 2013 has a "legislative year" of 2012.

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The Congress this vote was taken in. (e.g. 112, 113)

parameters.Name: voted_at
parameters.Description: The time the vote was taken.

parameters.Name: vote_type
parameters.Description: The type of vote being taken. This classification is imperfect and unofficial, and may change as we improve our detection.

parameters.Name: roll_type
parameters.Description: The official description of the type of vote being taken.

parameters.Name: required
parameters.Description: The required ratio of Aye votes necessary to pass the legislation, in fraction form. A value of "1/2" actually means more than 1/2. Ties are not possible in the Senate (the Vice President casts a tie-breaker vote), and in the House, a tie vote means the vote does not pass.

parameters.Name: result
parameters.Description: The official result of the vote. This is not completely standardized (both "Passed" and "Bill Passed" may appear). In the case of a vote for Speaker of the House, the result field contains the name of the victor.

parameters.Name: bill_id
parameters.Description: If a vote is related to a bill, the bill's ID. (e.g. "s968-112")

methods.Synopsis: Real time floor updates in the House and Senate. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: query
parameters.Description: A string fragment to match against floor updates' text.

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber this update took place in.

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The number of the Congress this update took place during.

parameters.Name: legislative_day
parameters.Description: The "legislative day" this update took place in, in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.Name: year
parameters.Description: The legislative year of the update.

parameters.Name: bill_ids
parameters.Description: The ID of a bill referenced in a floor update.

parameters.Name: roll_ids
parameters.Description: The ID of a roll call vote referenced in a floor update.

parameters.Name: legislator_ids
parameters.Description: The bioguide ID of a legislator referenced in a floor update.

methods.Synopsis: Search and filter hearings in the House and Senate.Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: query
parameters.Description: A string fragment to match against hearings' descriptions.

parameters.Name: committee_id
parameters.Description: The ID of the committee holding the hearing.

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The number of the Congress the committee hearing is taking place during.

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber of the committee holding the hearing.

parameters.Name: dc
parameters.Description: Whether the committee hearing is held in DC (true) or in the field (false).

parameters.Name: bill_ids
parameters.Description: The IDs of a bill mentioned by or associated with the hearing.

parameters.Name: hearing_type
parameters.Description: (House only) The type of hearing this is.

methods.Synopsis: Bills scheduled for upcoming debate in the House and Senate. Below are just the fields you can filter on - responses may have many more fields.

parameters.Name: legislative_day
parameters.Description: The legislative day this bill is scheduled for. Combine with the range field to understand precision. May be null.

parameters.Name: bill_id
parameters.Description: The ID of the bill that's been scheduled for debate.

parameters.Name: range
parameters.Description: How precise this information is.

parameters.Name: congress
parameters.Description: The number of the Congress this bill has been scheduled in.

parameters.Name: chamber
parameters.Description: The chamber which has scheduled this bill.

parameters.Name: source_type
parameters.Description: The source for this information.
